intro: Lomatium bicolor var. leptocarpum, commonly known as the slender-fruited lomatium, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its seeds are enclosed in small, dry fruits that are distinctive in shape and structure.
